channel.title: [Tutorial] How to play 1.1_02
channel.description:
[b]Beware! Unofficial versions of Notch's clients cannot get much help. I've paid for minecraft and these methods work for me when downgrading.[/b] Difficulty: 1/10 [hr] Step 1: [b]Downloading a client[/b] [i]applicable only if you have not paid for minecraft[/i] TabbyKiller's client [b][url=http://www.mediafire.com/?0godadlq8spc6bp]this[/url][/b] - Place both items in your .minecraft folder. Run "minecraft_name.jar", enter your name (remember, no impersonation!), and click OK. - Minecraft_name.jar may give you an error when you run it. If it does, you can get the current version [url=http://hotfile.com/dl/91245425/9bacc21/MC-Beta-1.1_02-by-LukaszDanio.rar.html]Here[/url] - Password to file = "LukaszDanio". It also comes with the minecraft_name.jar. [hr] LilXCJ's client: Links: http://www.mediafire.com/?6988po8yw5us8sw - Simply run the Minecraft.exe and you will automatically download the files from Notch's website after entering a name. - Do not need a paid account and passes through the authentication servers that Notch set up. Step 2: [b]Finding your .minecraft folder[/b] First you must find your .minecraft folder. This folder is automatically created (or you must place it) in your AppData/App Data/Application Data folder. To find it [b]manually[/b] you may need to unhide your folders. To do this you must click [b]tools[/b] in the menu bar. Click [b]folder options[/b], click the [b]view tab[/b] then click [b]Show hidden files and folders[/b]. For windows, the application data folder can be found after this process in C:\Documents and Settings\ADMINISTRATOR_USER*\Application Data\.minecraft *Administrator_User may be whatever your username is for that computer. To find it with the run program simply go to the start button in your task bar. Start -> Run -> "%appdata%" -> .minecraft Do not use the quotation marks when typing it in. [quote="ytuio9"]Unlike what most people think, you do not have to unhide your folders to find it manually. Open minecraft, click on mods and textures, click on show folder, and then navigate to the Roaming (or w/e you have) folder by utilizing the uber backspace key and send a shortcut to your desktop.[/quote] Step 3: [b]Downgrading your client[/b] For those who cannot do things by reading use this video by Krackkid himself! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AyCrQ4sAwdA Here are some 1.1_02 files [url=http://www.megaupload.com/?d=JASBQYVO]Megaupload[/url] - Provided by me, recieved from a friend [url=http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6059593/Minecraft_Beta_1.1_02]Piratebay[/url] Provided by MITB [url=http://dl.dropbox.com/u/8103910/minecraft.zip]Dropbox[/url] Provided by k0 twin, reupload of MITB's To the first link by me, here is the procedures to downgrading:
Now, how this works, is when you start Minecraft, it looks for the version file. I've included the version file from the new update, which means when Minecraft sees it, it looks like the game has updated, and doesn't bother to download and overwrite everything, while the game stays undated. After downloading - look for your .minecraft folder in Application Data. Unpack the bin.rar file that you download, into your bin folder, there. You're successfully downgraded. The server, using hey0's server wrapper, should have stayed downgraded, so that's not an issue, am I right? EDIT: Well, for everyone having issues, it's because I forgot that I have a few mods you have to accommodate for. =p I forgot I had them all, because they're useful mods that don't have an immediate effect on the game (like optimizers, and lighting mods.) For those of you who download this, follow the guide [url=http://www.minecraftforum.net/viewtopic.php?f=25&t=55700]Here[/url].
To the next two links, here is the procedures to downgrading
All you have to do, after you update to the latest client by running your paid for client, is replace the minecraft.jar in .minecraft/bin/ with the one in the zip from above, leave the version file alone. That way, it won't try to update and over-write it. It works.
For those who cannot do things by reading use this video by Krackkid himself! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AyCrQ4sAwdA You're done! Enjoy playing on 1.1_02 servers that keep their mods until Bukkit is released. FAQ Q: The screen stills say 1.2_01, this tutorial didn't work! A: This is because the version.file is not changing when we downgrade. This allows us to bypass the updater so the .minecraft\bin\ files do not update. Q: Help! I tried to downgrade but it doesn't work? A: Delete your .minecraft folder and retry another 1.1_02 that I have provided in this tutorial. One is sure to work. They all work on the official clients. Q: Minecraft is frozen or stuck? A: Delete your .minecraft folder and restart the game. You may have done something wrong. Q: Minecraft updated after following the tutorial! What do I do? A: [quote="Davidi2"]If you do that, let it update [b]once[/b], then replace the minecraft.jar again. (To make sure the version file is current)[/quote] I tried to keep it as simple as possible. Simply combining everything we've found into one clean topic.

@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:9, topic:379264”]Unlike what most people think, you do not have to unhide your folders to find it manually.
open minecraft game, click on mods and textures, click on show folder, and then navigate to the Roaming (or w/e you have) folder by utilizing the uber backspace key and send a shortcut to your desktop.[/quote]

Thanks, added this to the tutorial.

Also for errors. Make sure you try one method first, if it doesn’t work, delete your .minecraft folder, re-download the .minecraft folder from Notch then try another 1.1_02 download. Deleting your .minecraft folder allows you to start from scratch.

Read full topic

open minecraft game, click on mods and textures, click on show folder, and then navigate to the Roaming (or w/e you have) folder by utilizing the uber backspace key and send a shortcut to your desktop.

Anyways, nice guide for people who don’t know how to update.

item.title: [Tutorial] How to play 1.1_02
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Beware! Unofficial versions of Notch’s clients cannot get much help. I’ve paid for minecraft and these methods work for me when downgrading.

Difficulty: 1/10

[hr]

Step 1: Downloading a client applicable only if you have not paid for minecraft

TabbyKiller’s client this

  • Place both items in your .minecraft folder. Run “minecraft_name.jar”, enter your name (remember, no impersonation!), and click OK.
  • Minecraft_name.jar may give you an error when you run it. If it does, you can get the current version Here
  • Password to file = “LukaszDanio”. It also comes with the minecraft_name.jar.

[hr]

LilXCJ’s client: Links:
http://www.mediafire.com/?6988po8yw5us8sw

  • Simply run the Minecraft.exe and you will automatically download the files from Notch’s website after entering a name.
  • Do not need a paid account and passes through the authentication servers that Notch set up.

Step 2: Finding your .minecraft folder
First you must find your .minecraft folder. This folder is automatically created (or you must place it) in your AppData/App Data/Application Data folder. To find it manually you may need to unhide your folders. To do this you must click tools in the menu bar. Click folder options, click the view tab then click Show hidden files and folders. For windows, the application data folder can be found after this process in C:\Documents and Settings\ADMINISTRATOR_USER*\Application Data.minecraft
*Administrator_User may be whatever your username is for that computer.

To find it with the run program simply go to the start button in your task bar.
Start -> Run -> “%appdata%” -> .minecraft
Do not use the quotation marks when typing it in.

[quote=“ytuio9”]Unlike what most people think, you do not have to unhide your folders to find it manually.
Open minecraft, click on mods and textures, click on show folder, and then navigate to the Roaming (or w/e you have) folder by utilizing the uber backspace key and send a shortcut to your desktop.[/quote]

Step 3: Downgrading your client

For those who cannot do things by reading use this video by Krackkid himself!

Here are some 1.1_02 files
Megaupload - Provided by me, recieved from a friend
Piratebay Provided by MITB
Dropbox Provided by k0 twin, reupload of MITB’s

To the first link by me, here is the procedures to downgrading:

Now, how this works, is when you start Minecraft, it looks for the version file. I've included the version file from the new update, which means when Minecraft sees it, it looks like the game has updated, and doesn't bother to download and overwrite everything, while the game stays undated.

After downloading - look for your .minecraft folder in Application Data. Unpack the bin.rar file that you download, into your bin folder, there. You’re successfully downgraded.

The server, using hey0’s server wrapper, should have stayed downgraded, so that’s not an issue, am I right?

EDIT: Well, for everyone having issues, it’s because I forgot that I have a few mods you have to accommodate for. =p I forgot I had them all, because they’re useful mods that don’t have an immediate effect on the game (like optimizers, and lighting mods.)

For those of you who download this, follow the guide Here.

To the next two links, here is the procedures to downgrading

All you have to do, after you update to the latest client by running your paid for client, is replace the minecraft.jar in .minecraft/bin/ with the one in the zip from above, leave the version file alone. That way, it won't try to update and over-write it. It works.

For those who cannot do things by reading use this video by Krackkid himself!

You’re done!
Enjoy playing on 1.1_02 servers that keep their mods until Bukkit is released.

FAQ
Q: The screen stills say 1.2_01, this tutorial didn’t work!
A: This is because the version.file is not changing when we downgrade. This allows us to bypass the updater so the .minecraft\bin\ files do not update.

Q: Help! I tried to downgrade but it doesn’t work?
A: Delete your .minecraft folder and retry another 1.1_02 that I have provided in this tutorial. One is sure to work. They all work on the official clients.

Q: Minecraft is frozen or stuck?
A: Delete your .minecraft folder and restart the game. You may have done something wrong.

Q: Minecraft updated after following the tutorial! What do I do?
A: [quote=“Davidi2”]If you do that, let it update once, then replace the minecraft.jar again. (To make sure the version file is current)[/quote]

I tried to keep it as simple as possible. Simply combining everything we’ve found into one clean topic.

Read full topic
